item.title: Hulu + Live TV vs. [sc name='directv-stream-name']
item.dc:creator: Bill Frost
item.description:
Hulu + Live TV is both a live TV and on-demand TV streaming service, as the name suggests. In addition to over 70 live TV channels, it also gives you access to Hulu’s large library of on-demand TV shows, movies, and original series. Hulu + Live TV was also the first streaming service to employ a “+” in its name, if blame needs to be placed.

The post Hulu + Live TV vs. [sc name='directv-stream-name'] appeared first on CableTV.com.

Sponsored by DIRECTV

Binge-watch more of your favorite shows with DIRECTV

When the leaves fall, Fall TV shows drop—streaming with DIRECTV can make sure you catch them. New subscribers get three months of HBO Max™, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ®, Cinemax®, and MGM+™ included with select packages (a $175 value).

You can watch a lot in three months, trust us, as professional TV watchers, the CableTV.com staff knows. Catch up on summer hits like The White Lotus and Dexter: Resurrection, and get into the new season of Peacemaker, or new shows like Outlander: Blood of My Blood and It: Welcome to Derry.

Sign up for a free trial today to see how DIRECTV is revolutionizing streaming TV with its Signature Packages, innovative Gemini streaming device, and curated Genre Packs. This is DIRECTV like you’ve never seen it.

Hulu + Live TV is both a live TV and on-demand TV streaming service, as the name suggests. In addition to 95+ live TV channels, it also gives you access to Hulu’s large library of on-demand TV shows, movies, and original series. Hulu + Live TV was also the first streaming service to employ a “+” in its name, if blame needs to be placed.

Stream with DIRECTV, formerly known as DIRECTV STREAM, is the internet-streaming sibling of DIRECTV satellite TV service. It features similar plans and channel counts to the satellite service, as well as more expensive pricing than most other live TV streaming services.

TL;DR: We prefer Hulu + Live over Stream with DIRECTV in this matchup because we think you get more for your money with it. But, if you like fat channel counts (including most sports networks), Stream with DIRECTV might be worth it for you.

Hulu + Live TV vs. Stream with DIRECTV pros and cons

Hulu + Live TV

✓ Hulu included
✓ On-demand network shows
✗ Some popular channels missing

Stream with DIRECTV

✓ Large channel counts
✓ No contract
✗ Expensive plans

Need more internet speed for your TV?

For live TV streaming, you’ll want to up your download speeds. Enter your zip code below to see top internet providers in your area.

Jump to:

  • Deals and promotions
  • Compare Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV
  • Plans and pricing
  • Live channels
  • Specs and features

Deals and promotions

There are several deals to be had with Hulu + Live TV, including the popular Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ bundle—check out our Hulu deals guide for all the details.

New Stream with DIRECTV subscribers can get three months of HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ, CINEMAX, and MGM+ for free on the ENTERTAINMENT, CHOICE, and ULTIMATE plans.

Compare Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV head to head

Service Price Channels Streams Cloud DVR Details
Hulu + Live TV $81.99–$95.99/mo. 95+ 2 (Unlimited upgrade $9.99/mo.) Unlimited (9 mos.) View plans

Read Hulu + Live TV Review
Stream with DIRECTV $89.99–$169.99/mo.* 90–185+ 3–unlimited 20 hrs. View plans

Read Stream with DIRECTV Review

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change. See full disclaimer for details.

There’s technically only one Hulu + Live TV plan. The price differences depend on whether you don’t mind or don’t want ads in your on-demand content (it costs $13 more a month for the commercial-free experience). Again, we like Hulu + Live TV’s lower pricing.

Stream with DIRECTV’s four plans are similar to DIRECTV’s satellite plans in both price and channel counts. Unlike DIRECTV Satellite, Stream with DIRECTV doesn’t require an annual contract or a dish on your roof—a nice score for minimalism.

Plans and pricing

Hulu + Live TV plans and pricing

Plan Price Channels Streams Cloud DVR Details
Hulu + Live TV (with ads) $81.99/mo. 95+ 2 (Unlimited upgrade $9.99/mo.) Unlimited (9 mos.) View Plan
Hulu + Live TV (no ads) $95.99/mo. 95+ 2 (Unlimited upgrade $9.99/mo.) Unlimited (9 mos.) View Plan

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Starting at $81.99–$95.99/mo., Hulu + Live TV gives you 95+ live TV channels and unlimited cloud DVR storage. For comparison, YouTube TV features over 100 live channels and unlimited cloud DVR storage (for nine months) for $82.99/mo.. But Hulu + Live TV isn’t just a live TV service—factor in its on-demand Hulu, Disney+, and ESPN+ library (which you can get for $82.99/mo., just one more dollar a month than Hulu + Live TV by itself), and Hulu + Live TV looks like a better deal than Stream with DIRECTV.

Stream with DIRECTV plans and pricing

Plan Price* Channels Streams Cloud DVR Details
Stream with DIRECTV ENTERTAINMENT $89.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 90+ 3 (unlimited inside home network) 20 hrs. (Unlimited, $10.00/mo.) View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV CHOICE™ $94.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 125+ 3 (unlimited inside home network) 20 hrs. (Unlimited, $10.00/mo.) View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV ULTIMATE $124.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 160+ 3 (unlimited inside home network) 20 hrs. (Unlimited, $10.00/mo.) View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV PREMIER $169.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 185+ 3 (unlimited inside home network) 20 hrs. (Unlimited, $10.00/mo.) View Plan

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change. See full disclaimer for details.

Stream with DIRECTV is pricey, period. The channel counts are impressive, but you’d have to pay an extra $10 a month to upgrade the cloud DVR to keep up with all those channels (20 included hours, puh-leez). Stream with DIRECTV also offers to rent you its streaming box for another $10 a month, but don’t take the bait with its new unwieldy name—you can use your own streaming device just as easily.

Cord-cutting savings

Not feeling Hulu + Live TV or Stream with DIRECTV? Look into the other live TV streaming services we’ve reviewed.

The numbers look close, but Hulu + Live TV’s single 95+-channel plan gives you more popular cable networks than Stream with DIRECTV‘s cheapest (ENTERTAINMENT) plan. Stream with DIRECTV’s CHOICE plan is more comparable to Hulu + Live TV, and while it does cost a few dollars less than Hulu + Live TV’s cheapest plan, remember: you also get Disney+ and ESPN+ with your Hulu + Live TV sub.

Hulu + Live TV vs. Stream with DIRECTV sports channels

Channel Hulu + Live TV Stream with DIRECTV ENTERTAINMENT Stream with DIRECTV CHOICE Stream with DIRECTV ULTIMATE Stream with DIRECTV PREMIER

Data effective as of post date.

This is where the pigskin really hits the astroturf: Hulu + Live TV covers sports pretty well (especially on the college level). But, if you’re willing to shell out more for either Stream with DIRECTV’s ULTIMATE or PREMIER plans, you can get nearly all the sports networks you’ll ever want—minus a couple of NFL channels that aren’t on Hulu + Live TV, either. Stream with DIRECTV also has a great selection of regional sports networks, depending on your billing location.

If you’re wondering, NFL SUNDAY TICKET is no longer available through DIRECTV. It moved to YouTube TV starting with the 2023 season.

Hulu + Live TV vs. Stream with DIRECTV local channels

Channel* Hulu + Live TV Stream with DIRECTV ENTERTAINMENT Stream with DIRECTV CHOICE Stream with DIRECTV ULTIMATE Stream with DIRECTV PREMIER
ABC ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
CBS ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
The CW ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
FOX ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
NBC ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
PBS — ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
Telemundo ✔ — — — —

*Availability varies by area. Data effective as of post date.

Both Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV carry local ABC, CBS, FOX, and NBC stations. Worth noting: Stream with DIRECTV recently added PBS and PBS Kids.

Local channels are easy to get beyond streaming, though—all you need is a digital antenna to pick up area broadcasts over-the-air for free.

Premium channels and add-on packages

Channel Hulu + Live TV Stream with DIRECTV
HBO Max/HBO $16.99/mo. $16.99/mo.
CINEMAX $9.99/mo. $11.00/mo.
Paramount+ with SHOWTIME $11.99/mo. $12.99/mo.
STARZ $10.99/mo. $11.00/mo.
MGM+ — $6.99/mo.

Data effective as of post date.

The big difference here is that Hulu + Live TV doesn’t offer MGM+ as a premium add-on channel. Stream with DIRECTV offers all five of the biggest premium add-ons (all of which you could also subscribe to with separate standalone apps, btw). Stream with DIRECTV ekes out a small victory here.

Specs and features

Cloud DVR

Service Included storage Upgrades
Hulu + Live TV Unlimited (9 mos.) —
Stream with DIRECTV 20 hrs. Unlimited ($10.00/mo.)

Hulu + Live TV’s unlimited hours of cloud DVR space makes Stream with DIRECTV’s included 20 look, well, sad.

Stream with DIRECTV can be upgraded to unlimited storage for a price, but other live TV streaming services are far more generous with their clouds (fuboTV includes 1,000 hours of storage, for example). We give Hulu + Live TV the W for cloud DVR space here.

Multiple streams

Service Simultaneous streams Upgrades Offline downloads
Hulu + Live TV 2 Unlimited ($9.99/mo.) ✔
Stream with DIRECTV 3–unlimited — —

We’ve never understood Hulu + Live TV’s insistence on two simultaneous streams when the standard is at least three. Stream with DIRECTV also supports unlimited simultaneous streams when connected at home. If you’re going to put this to the test, we recommend a fast internet service. Easy win for Stream with DIRECTV here.

Compatible devices

Device Hulu + Live TV Stream with DIRECTV
Amazon Fire Cube, Stick, TV ✔ ✔
Android phones, tablets ✔ ✔
Android TV ✔ ✔
Apple TV (4th gen.) ✔ ✔
Apple TV 4K ✔ ✔
Chromecast, Chromecast with Google TV ✔ ✔
Echo Show ✔ —
iPhone, iPad ✔ ✔
LG TVs (select models) ✔ ✔
Nintendo Switch ✔ —
NVIDIA SHIELD Pro TV — —
PC, Mac web browsers ✔ ✔
PlayStation 3, 4, 5 ✔ —
Roku Ultra, Express, Premiere, Stick, TV ✔ ✔
Samsung TVs (select models) ✔ ✔
TiVo Stream ✔ —
Wii — —
Xbox One ✔ —

Hulu + Live TV is available for more devices, but Stream with DIRECTV is on most of the popular ones (excluding PlayStation).

Also, is Wii ever going to make a comeback as a TV streaming device? These are the questions that keep us up at night.

Video and audio quality

Both Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV steam live TV at 720p and most on-demand content at 1080p (or Blu-ray quality—remember Blu-rays?). Some of Hulu’s on-demand shows and movies are available in 4K UHD (if your device can handle it); Stream with DIRECTV doesn’t do 4K at all. Video edge to Hulu + Live TV.

Sound-wise, both services stream standard 2.0 stereo audio, with some programming available in Dolby 5.1 Surround Sound—but you’d need a decent soundbar to notice it. We call this one a draw.

Check your internet

To get the most out of live TV streaming, you’ll want a fast internet connection. If you need more speed, check out our reviews of the best cheap internet providers.

Is Hulu + Live TV or Stream with DIRECTV better?

We think Hulu + Live TV wins the streaming showdown here: it has a majority of the most popular live TV channels, with the added bonus of the giant on-demand Hulu library of TV shows, movies, and originals. As a live/on-demand hybrid TV streaming service, Hulu + Live TV can’t be beat (mostly because it’s the only one).

While we do like Stream with DIRECTV’s abundance of channels, we’re not here for the price tag (or its new and cumbersome name). Newbie cord-cutters might enjoy the easy transition from satellite to streaming (the interface is nearly indistinguishable from DIRECTV, save for the lack of channel numbers), but Stream with DIRECTV is a bit pricey for our cost-to-value tastes.

Hulu + Live TV vs. Stream with DIRECTV FAQ

Is Hulu + Live TV better than [sc name='directv-stream-name']?

After reviewing both, we think Hulu + Live TV is a better streaming service than Stream with DIRECTV. Hulu + Live TV is less expensive than Stream with DIRECTV’s best plans, it features an excellent lineup of popular channels, and it gives you access to the on-demand Hulu library of TV shows, movies, and originals.

What’s the best streaming service to replace DIRECTV?

In the head-to-head matchup between Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV, we prefer Hulu + Live TV. However, our pick for best overall live TV streaming service is YouTube TV, which features 100+ live channels, an unlimited cloud DVR, and Google-enhanced search capability.

Do Hulu + Live TV and [sc name='directv-stream-name'] carry local channels?

Both Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV carry local channels affiliated with ABC, CBS, FOX, and NBC, though availability varies by area. Other than YouTube TV, Stream with DIRECTV is the only live TV streaming service that has PBS.

Why you should trust us

Our experts employed hours of hands-on testing and crunched the numbers, rating Hulu + Live TV and Stream with DIRECTV on bang for your buck, reliability, features, and customer satisfaction. Then we matched up the live TV streamers head to head to give a clearer picture of their strengths and weaknesses. For more information on our methodology, check out our How We Rank page.

  • Best Live TV Streaming Services

item.title: What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (Oct. 13–19)
item.dc:creator: Randy Harward
item.description:
This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the new Adult Swim show Haha You Clowns (also streaming on HBO Max), Michael Chernus playing the title role in Peacock’s Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy on Peacock, the third season of Loot on Apple TV+, and more. Let’s hit the couch!

The post What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (Oct. 13–19) appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
CableTV.com’s fall TV preview guide is here!

Embrace cozy season with the best fall TV! The TV experts at CableTV.com have curated a list of top fall TV shows to help you find something to binge-watch while the leaves drop.

New on TV this week

This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the new Adult Swim show Haha You Clowns  (also streaming on HBO Max), Michael Chernus playing the title role in Peacock’s Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy on Peacock, and the third season of Loot on Apple TV+.

We also have the horror reality series Guts & Glory and the 2025 Fangoria Chainsaw Awards on Shudder, Hal & Harper on video-on-demand (VOD), the final season of Solar Opposites on Hulu. Let’s hit the couch!

Night owl? Peep what’s on late-night TV this week.

New on Hulu this week

Solar Opposites | Hulu | Adult animation, comedy, sci-fi

Season 6 premiere, Monday, Oct. 13: It’s last call for Korvo and family, as Solar Opposites—the adult-animation series co-created by Rick and Morty co-creator Justin Roiland—is about to begin its sixth and final season. Expect to see the fam struggle to live on a budget and find out what happens in the shocking conclusion to the parallel storyline about The Wall. All ten episodes are available to stream as of today.

Best Movies and Shows on Hulu

Pro tip: Looking for a hair-raising series to binge? Check out Sophie Hastings’ The Best Scary Shows Streaming Right Now.

New on Shudder and AMC+ this week

Guts & Glory | Shudder, AMC+ | Reality, horror

Series premiere, Tuesday, Oct. 14, 9:00 p.m. ET: OMG, OMG, OMG! I hate reality shows, especially competition reality shows. But boy, oh boy, am I excited to see the challenges legendary special effects artist Greg Nicotero serves up in this series—’cause they’re based on the contestants’ own deep-seated fears. Yup, we’re about to witness the closest thing to a real-life horror film. Nicotero says the show is what would happen “if Survivor and The Blair Witch Project had a baby.” Oh, this is art, folks—and I’m here for it. (P.s. Shudder doesn’t have a public-facing trailer up, so sorry for the AI clip.)

Best Movies and Shows on Shudder

Pro tip: Horror fans: Tune in to Shudder on Sunday, October 19 at 9 p.m. ET for the 2025 Fangoria Chainsaw Awards!

See what to watch this weekend on all platforms

Click on your favorite streaming service below to see new releases and classic recommendations from our TV critics.

New on Apple TV+ this week

Loot | Apple TV+ | Comedy

Season 3 premiere, Wednesday, Oct. 15: Maya Rudolph is back as Molly Wells, the woman who divorced her tech-billionaire husband and intends to use every cent of her $87 billion settlement for good. (Sounds a lot like Jeff Bezo’s split with his ex, doesn’t it.) The third season picks up where the Season 2 cliffhanger left off—but we won’t spoil that for those of you who haven’t seen the show yet.

Read Our Apple TV+ Review

New on Peacock this week

Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy | Peacock | Drama

Limited series premiere, Thursday, Oct. 16: Michael Chernus excels at playing lovable weirdos (see Severance, Patriot). But I’m afraid—based on the trailer for this show—that Chernus is gonna be just as good at portraying infamous serial killer John Wayne Gacy, who killed at least 33 young men and boys from 1972–78. I mean, good for him, clap-clap-clap. But, man, it’s weird to applaud someone for reaching into himself and pulling out a Gacy portrayal that can make me queasy in a trailer. Anyway, Devil in Disguise is gonna be good. All eight episodes are available to stream on Peacock as of today.

Read our Peacock Review

Want more new TV shows?

« Catch Up on the Best TV Shows of 2024
Discover the Best TV Shows of 2025 »

New on MUBI this week

Hal & Harper | MUBI | Comedy, drama

Limited series premiere, Sunday, Oct. 19: From writer/director/actor Cooper Raiff (Shithouse, Cha Cha Real Smooth) comes this heartfelt comedy about a pair of adult siblings (Raiff, Lili Reinhart) who revisit their shared past trauma when their father (Mark Ruffalo) announces his girlfriend (Betty Gilpin) is pregnant with a new sibling. As with Raiff’s aforementioned films, Hal & Harper is fielding praise from critics. And the series’ successful screening at Sundance and debut on MUBI—two entities best known for indie films—shows it’s not your usual small-screen fodder.

Looking for your next binge-watch?

« Binge an Entire Show This Weekend
Start a Classic Binge-Worthy Show »

New on HBO Max this week

Haha, You Clowns | Adult Swim, HBO Max | Adult animation, comedy

Series premiere, Sunday, Oct.19, 11:45 p.m.: Get a load of this one-liner description of Joe Cappa’s Haha, You Clowns: “Three delightful himbos and their grieving father find laughter and love in this family oriented series.” Uh . . . I thought this was Adult Swim. What’s with the feelings and stuff? Don’t worry; Cappa’s show isn’t Hallmark-cheesy. In fact, after screening an episode, I’ve decided that Adult Swim-cheesy is a thing. That’s to say, it’s possible to be absurd while also eliciting warm fuzzies and tears. Haha, You Clowns airs live on HBO every Sunday night and streams on HBO Max the next day.

item.title: CableTV.com’s Internet, TV, and Mobile Deals of the Week (October 13–October 20): Free Gift Cards Galore
item.dc:creator: Logan Jones
item.description:
Stop overpaying! CableTV.com’s deals expert finds the week's deepest internet, TV, & mobile deals and discounts. Get exclusive, updated savings you won't find anywhere else.

The post CableTV.com’s Internet, TV, and Mobile Deals of the Week (October 13–October 20): Free Gift Cards Galore appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Finding the best internet, TV, and mobile deals can be super overwhelming. Trust me, I know: Half of my job is hunting down the best deals, combing through disclaimers for expiration dates, and sifting through other fine print to uncover the details of the best current promos for all the top telco and streaming services.

That’s why I’ve started this weekly column to keep readers up-to-date with the best deals that providers are currently running. This page is updated weekly with a fresh batch of deals released over the past week, so be sure to bookmark it for future reference.

✦ Allow me to introduce myself! My name is Logan Jones, and I’ve been CableTV.com’s resident deals expert for close to three years. As part of the editorial staff, it’s my job to keep readers updated with all the latest internet, TV, and mobile promotions. I update all 20+ of our deals pages at the beginning of each month, and keep an eye out for new promos as they drop.

Wanna keep up with the top deals and entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter to get updated on the latest money-saving promotions, TV-viewing guides, and entertaining takes.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Internet providers are enticing new customers with free cash this fall💰🤑

It’s not uncommon for providers to sweeten the pot for new customers with some limited-time promos. I mean, that’s basically what this whole column is about.

But what I really appreciate is when providers just straight up give out free cash. Sure, discounts on services and price guarantees are great, but nothing beats the satisfaction of signing up for a service and getting sent real money (in the form of a gift card, that is).

I usually find one or two providers who are running these gift card promos, but this month, there are quite a few. Better yet, most are available to any new customers—although there is one super sweet student-specific deal I’ll talk about. Keep reading for all the details.

Check out all of the current promos from top providers

Click on your internet, TV, or streaming service of choice to find all the best provider-specific deals updated monthly.

How to claim your free gift cards this October

Let me get this out of the way first: All of these deals are for new customers only. To get these free reward cards, you’ll need to either switch providers, upgrade your plan, or sign up for a new service altogether. The Ts and Cs will vary for each deal.

So, if you’re already in the market for a new internet (or TV) provider, great! There are quite a few to choose from that are handing out reward cards for signing up.

IMO, the best deal right now is DIRECTV’s switcher deal, where you can get up to a $200 Visa Reward Card when you switch to DIRECTV. (Did you know that I named DIRECTV the best TV provider for promos this year? This promo is one reason why.)

T-Mobile’s also offering an equally great deal for new 5G Home Internet customers, offering up $200 in gift cards when you switch. AT&T’s offering a little less money (up to $150) for signing up, but their fiber internet plans are top-notch, so it’s still a win-win.

Optimum’s slinging a bit less (up to $100) for new internet subscribers, but apparently, new customers should be wary. When searching up info on this deal, I came across a Reddit thread full of agitated Optimum customers who haven’t received their gift cards. Here’s what one user had to say about their experience:

“I signed up in July 2023 and was told I will receive a $100 gift card after 3 months. In October they told me my card was shipped out and it will take 2-3 weeks. It is now at the end of December and I still haven’t received it… I called Optimum and chatted via their online support and was told to contact 877-425-8423 which is the company that sends out the gift cards. Guess what? They do not answer and have not returned my voicemails…. lol Optimum is a scam for this… Highly disappointed.”

Pro tip: Free stuff is great and all, but you don’t want to get roped into a plan that you don’t totally love just for the promise of a great deal. I highly recommend you check out our Best Internet Providers and Best TV Providers guides to help you choose which provider to sign up for.

Students, want free Uber Eats and Amazon this semester?

Xfinity, our perennial fave provider for student discounts, is offering up a great one for college students for a limited time.

Students who sign up for 1 Gig Xfinity Internet from now until October 21 can get a $200 gift card from Uber Eats or Amazon.

I was in college not all that long ago, and I know that $200 goes a long way for a broke college student. I also know that students are prone to procrastination—keep putting off that essay, sure, but don’t miss out on this deal.

Get Your $200 Gift Card

Looking for even more deals?

Best TV Deals This Month
Best Internet Deals This Month

Some things never change…

While some providers tend to switch out deals on the reg, others like to keep things more stable (which I appreciate, seeing as I personally update all 20+ of our deals pages each month😅).

Here are some of the best perpetual deals from top TV and internet providers:

  • Amazon Prime Video: 30-day free trial
  • DIRECTV: HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, MGM+, CINEMAX, STARZ free for 3 mos.
  • DISH: Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ, and DISH Movie Pack free for 3 mos.
  • Hulu: 30-day free trial
  • Verizon: Up to $200 in gift cards with Verizon’s Fios TV plans
  • Xfinity: Get an Unlimited line included for a year with a 300 Mbps or faster Xfinity Internet plan
« See Last Week's Deals

The post CableTV.com’s Internet, TV, and Mobile Deals of the Week (October 13–October 20): Free Gift Cards Galore appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
ABC, FOX, FS1, TBS, ESPN, and ESPN2 are home to MLB postseason games, and we’ve outlined the best TV providers for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin on Tuesday, September 30, and culminate with the 121st edition of the World Series, which starts Friday, October 24. You can watch playoff games on popular baseball channels from ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports, though channel lineups vary across each round.

American League fans should have FOX and FS1 locked and loaded for key matchups. However, National League followers will need access to TNT Sports channels like TBS and truTV, or a subscription to HBO Max, to catch that side of the postseason bracket.

Scroll down to see which TV providers carry these channels and how you can watch some playoff action for free.

Jump to:

  • MLB Playoffs channels
  • MLB Playoffs TV schedule
  • Watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get the most MLB action on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels are the MLB Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLB Playoffs will likely air across six channels, based on last year’s schedule:

  • ABC
  • FOX
  • FS1
  • TBS
  • truTV
  • ESPN
  • ESPN2

Most MLB playoff channels are easy to find from various TV providers, but you may need a higher-tier TV plan to access specific networks. Additionally, ESPN Deportes, Fox Deportes, MLB Network, truTV, UniMás, and Univision will carry Spanish-language postseason coverage.

Pro tip: All games airing on FOX and FS1 will stream on FOX One, while TBS games will stream on HBO Max’s Standard and Premium plans. But it’s important to note that you might not need every playoff channel listed above, especially if you’re only tuning in for a specific team.

MLB Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin in late September, starting with the Wild Card Series. After that, the action moves to the divisional and league series. The 121st World Series begins in late October.

See the first table below to find out when each series starts and which channels you can watch them on. Then, for a more comprehensive look at each series, click on the drop-down menus a little further down. I’ll be updating the schedules as the postseason unfolds.

Best TV plans for watching the MLB Playoffs

Now that you know the channels you’ll need to watch this year’s playoffs, you have a better idea of what to look for when choosing a TV provider. But we’ll make it a step easier. Here’s a list of our three favorite postseason TV plans.

  • Antenna: You can catch every playoff game airing on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, as long as you’re within range of a local affiliate station. Check out our Watch For Free section below for more on this viewing option.
  • Sling TV + Antenna: Sling TV is the most affordable option for watching the MLB Playoffs because its Sling Orange + Blue plan offers FS1, TBS, and ESPN for just $60.99/mo.. While it lacks nationwide coverage for ABC and FOX, you can still stream ABC games through ESPN3 and use an antenna for FOX broadcasts.
  • YouTube TV: At $82.99/mo., YouTube TV is an excellent service for streaming the MLB Postseason. You’ll get every playoff channel and sick features like multiview and unlimited DVR storage. We typically don’t recommend YouTube TV during the MLB regular season because it lacks MLB Network and crucial regional sports networks. But that won’t affect your viewing experience during the playoffs.

Which TV providers offer MLB playoff channels?

Most major TV providers offer the core MLB playoff networks, covering everything from the Wild Card Series to the World Series. Our table below highlights 13 popular providers and whether they carry the necessary channels.

Check TV providers in your area

Don’t miss a single minute of the MLB Playoffs. Enter your zip code below to see which TV providers are available for your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase†)
MLB playoff channels:
ABC and FOX
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Because the MLB Playoffs air across several basic cable networks, you’ll need a TV subscription to access the entire slate of playoff games. Some live TV streaming services offer free trials, but most don’t last longer than seven days.

You can watch a slice of playoff action without subscribing to a TV plan using an OTA antenna on your smart TV. Since ABC and FOX air various playoff games, you can tune in for free through your local network affiliates. That’s especially important since FOX will show the complete World Series.

If you need a high-quality antenna, we suggest checking out the Mohu Leaf 50. It’s one of our favorite antennas because of its 60-mile range and 4K capabilities. Though, you’ll want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool before committing to an antenna. That way, you can ensure ABC and FOX stations are within range of your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs FAQ

What app can I watch the MLB Playoffs on?

If you already have access to MLB playoff channels through a TV provider, you can watch live games through individual channel apps like ESPN, FOX Sports, and TBS. All you need to do is sign in to each app with your TV provider credentials. You can also watch the MLB Playoffs through the MLB app, but you’ll need an eligible TV provider login for live game access.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs without cable?

Without cable, you can watch the entire MLB Playoffs through most live TV streaming services. We recommend Sling TV because it’s the cheapest way to get ESPN, FS1, and TBS in one plan (Sling Orange + Blue at $60.99/mo.), but you’ll likely need an antenna for FOX coverage.

Does Amazon Prime have the MLB Playoffs?

No, a basic Amazon Prime Video subscription doesn’t include nationally televised MLB games like the MLB Playoffs. But you can watch some MLB coverage through Prime Video using add-ons like HBO Max Standard and MLB.TV.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs in Canada?

In Canada, you can watch live MLB Postseason and World Series games on Sportsnet. The most straightforward way to tune in is with a standard Sportsnet+ subscription. You can also catch Candian French–language coverage on RDS and TVA.

What is the new format for the MLB Playoffs?

The current postseason format launched in 2022 when the MLB expanded to a six-team American League and National League playoff bracket. Now, the Wild Card round is a best-of-three series instead of a single-elimination game, and the top two division winners of each league receive byes into the Division Series. Check out the MLB’s Postseason Format Explainer for a closer look at how it all works.

Why you should trust us

Our baseball experts researched the best ways to watch the MLB Playoffs by comparing the most popular TV providers head to head. We based our viewing recommendations primarily on ease of use—focusing on each provider’s channel lineups, pricing, and set-up process.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NBA Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The NBA preseason marks the perfect opportunity to rekindle your passion for your favorite basketball teams. Fortunately, you can watch most preseason games across local and national channels.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NBA Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

I get excited for the NBA season every October. It’s almost as exciting as Halloween for me—almost. And the best way to prepare for the marathon 82-game season is by keeping a close eye on the preseason.

The NBA preseason gives fans the first glimpses of new players, new coaches, or young players in new roles looking to make a leap. Even though the games don’t count, they at times could provide clues into whether a team will have a good or awful season.

If you’re not attending a preseason game in person, this guide is for you. I’ll give you the best ways to watch games on TV or streaming, and provide you with a full schedule of games.

Jump to:

  • NBA preseason channels
  • NBA preseason TV schedule
  • Best NBA preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NBA preseason for free

Score the best NBA TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to view your area’s top TV providers for watching local and national NBA coverage.

What channels are NBA preseason games on?

You can watch nationally televised NBA preseason games on NBA TV, ESPN, ESPN2, and Peacock. Due to NBA’s new media deal, TNT will no longer be a hub for NBA games.

Keep in mind, though, that most preseason matchups air locally on each team’s regional sports network (RSN) or over-the-air affiliate.

Pro tip: NBA preseason games that air locally also stream on NBA League Pass for out-of-market fans.

2025 NBA preseason schedule

This season’s NBA preseason calendar spans the first few weeks of October. Teams will play various home and away games, with several happening in non-NBA markets. Additional preseason games will occur internationally or feature teams from foreign leagues. It all leads to the start of the regular season on October 21.

Hit the drop-down menus below for the full 2025 NBA preseason TV schedule—including game times and channel listings. Most games appearing on NBA League Pass also air on each participating team’s in-market NBA channel.

New this year is the addition of Peacock to the schedule.

Best TV plans for watching the NBA preseason

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite way to watch the NBA preseason. It carries every national NBA channel and most RSNs. With plans starting at $69.99 a month, Stream with DIRECTV is kinda pricey for simply watching preseason games. But it’ll set you up nicely for the NBA regular season.

Ultimately, the best TV plan for watching any sports league depends on your ride-or-die teams. Using the schedule above for reference, here are my three viewing recommendations based on game type.

  1. Local games: Stream with DIRECTV and Fubo offer the most RSN coverage of any streaming service. Though, some local games stream free online and air on antenna TV channels—making a paid TV subscription unnecessary for certain fans.
  2. Out-of-market games: NBA League Pass is the league’s out-of-market TV package designed for fans who don’t live near their preferred team. The service also comes with NBA TV for additional NBA and WNBA coverage.
  3. National games: Any TV service that offers ESPN and NBA TV will get you nationally televised NBA games. Sling TV offers the cheapest way to get those channels with its Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and Sports Extra add-on ($11.00 a month). You’re also gonna need Peacock for any games streaming there.

Which TV providers carry NBA preseason games?

TV providers that offer ESPN and NBA TV will get you some NBA preseason games. Services like DIRECTV, Fubo, and Spectrum offer more coverage through RSNs, but channel lineups and game availability can vary based on your location.

How to watch the NBA preseason for free

Some NBA teams offer free viewing options during the preseason. For instance, the Sacramento Kings stream matches on Kings.com, while the Phoenix Suns air on Arizona’s Family channels (KTVK and KPHE-LD).

If you want more robust preseason coverage, you can also opt for a free trial of Stream with DIRECTV or Fubo. Both services have an array of RSNs and national NBA networks. But you won’t get any games streaming on Peacock because that service doesn’t currently offer a free trial.

Try DIRECTV for Free

How to watch the NBA preseason FAQ

Does NBA League Pass include preseason games?

Yes, you can stream select NBA preseason games on NBA League Pass. The streaming service also includes NBA TV, which airs many NBA and WNBA matchups each year.

Is the NBA preseason on Hulu?

Yes, all NBA preseason games that air on ESPN are available to stream on Hulu + Live TV. The live TV streaming service doesn’t offer NBA TV and NBA League Pass, but you can sign up for those services separately.

When does the NBA preseason start?

The 2025 NBA preseason starts on Thursday, October 2, with a matchup between the Philadelphia 76ers and New York Knicks. in Abu Dhabi. Preseason ends on Friday, October 17, four days before NBA Opening Day.

Are NBA preseason games on Peacock?

Yes, there is at least two NBA preseason games scheduled to stream on Peacock as of publication. The first is between the Chicago Bulls and Boston Celtics on Tuesday, October 7. The second is between the Oklahoma City Thunder and Milwaukee Bucks on Tuesday, October 14.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, researched and compiled a list of every NBA preseason game this year. Using that list, he examined channel listings and compared popular TV providers to determine the best ways to watch the NBA preseason considering the league’s new TV deal. He based his provider recommendations on game counts, pricing, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch Alabama Football
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Roll Tide! Check out our college football schedule guide for the Alabama Crimson Tide.

The post How To Watch Alabama Football appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free with Fubo

Alabama fans, close out of those message boards and stop waiting for the Finebaum call-in line: CableTV.com’s here for you after a rough year.

Everyone anticipated some growing pains during Kalen DeBoer’s first season in Tuscaloosa, but missing the College Football Playoff? Dropping four games with sloppy defensive play? Losing to Vanderbilt?!

But for as rocky as things got last year, don’t throw out your jersey and flash back to the Mike Shula era just yet. This offseason, Alabama reeled in yet another top-five recruiting class and reunited with new offensive coordinator Ryan Grubb, who guided DeBoer’s 2023 Washington Huskies squad to the national championship game. (And of course, having players like receiver Ryan Williams ensures that Alabama’s floor remains safely high.)

Can Alabama bounce back after a tough year and return to the postseason? Here’s what you need to know if you want to watch Alabama football on TV this season.

Jump to:

  • Watch Alabama vs. Florida State
  • Alabama football TV schedule
  • Watch Alabama football live

How can I watch the Alabama game today?

Alabama kicks off the 2025 season against Florida State on Saturday, August 30, at 2:30 p.m. CT on ABC.

Check out our How To Watch College Football guide and college football schedule preview column to learn how to watch college football on TV today. Want to watch Alabama football on TV? Enter your zip code below to see providers in your area.

Alabama football TV schedule 2025

Alabama’s non-conference slate should give the Crimson Tide ample opportunities to work out some kinks. Despite Week 1’s disastrous loss to Florida State, the Tide should still be favored in tune-up games against Louisiana-Monroe and Wisconsin.

But Kalen DeBoer’s squad will have its work cut out for it in SEC conference play. Alabama will open against Georgia before facing a slate of dangerous teams like Vanderbilt, South Carolina, and LSU that are more than capable of getting a win against the Crimson Tide. Alabama’s strength of schedule ranks all the way at 11th, per ESPN’s Bill Connelly.

Check back every week for up-to-date broadcast times and TV channels for every Alabama Crimson Tide football game.

item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
How far can the BYU Cougars football team go without Jake Retzlaff at QB? Our detailed guide will help Cougar Nation watch every Cougars game in 2025.

The post How To Watch BYU Cougars Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

BYU star quarterback Jake Retzlaff was accused of sexual assault, faced a seven-game suspension from the religious school for violating its honor code, withdrew from the school, and is reportedly headed to Tulane. So what’s next for the Cougars?

BYU football made waves in its first year in the Big 12 Conference last season, going 11–2 overall and 7–2 in conference play. Without Retzlaff this season, the Cougars have big question marks about their offense, although they do have running back L.J. Martin and wide receiver Chase Roberts returning.

Will the Cougars be a surprise again in Year 2 of the Big 12, or will they take a gigantic step back? Read my comprehensive watch guide to learn how to keep tabs on BYU football in 2025.

How to watch BYU Cougars football FAQ

Where can I watch the BYU Cougars for free?

You can stream many BYU Cougars football games with a DIRECTV free trial, but be aware of local blackouts and games exclusive to other platforms. You can also watch any games airing on your local ABC, CBS, FOX, or NBC station for free with a simple digital antenna.

Where can I stream BYU Cougars football games if I don’t have cable?

My favorite way to watch the BYU Cougars without cable is through Hulu + Live TV. The streaming service has every core college football channel, including ESPN+. But you may still need a separate subscription for games exclusive to Peacock (for Big Ten games) or FloFootball (for smaller conferences).

Can I watch BYU Cougars football on ESPN+?

Yes, you can watch select BYU Cougars football games on ESPN+. At the time of publication, at least one matchup involving the Cougars will appear on ESPN+ during the 2025 season. That game is Saturday, Aug. 30, against Portland State at 8:00 p.m. ET.

How do I watch BYU Cougars football if I live out of state?

For out-of-state fans, most BYU Cougars games air nationally, so a good live TV streaming service will have you covered. Of course, some college football matchups have unique broadcast rights. That’s why it’s always best to check my TV schedule above for specific channel information.
